document.docAuthor: Krüger, Thaysa C., Churata, Julissa, Castro-Guedes, Camila F. & Almeida, Lúcia M.
document.docTitle: Chnoodes brulei Krüger & Churata & Castro-Guedes & Almeida 2018, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: New species of Chnoodes Chevrolat (Coleoptera: Coccinellidae) from French Guiana

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New species of Chnoodes Chevrolat (Coleoptera: Coccinellidae) from French Guiana

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis .
Chnoodes brulei
sp. nov.
resembles
C. rubra
sp. nov.
and
C. cerasus
sp. nov.
in the color of the integument, but differs in the size and shape of the male genitalia and in the shape of the spermatheca.

Description. Male. Length 2.77–3.28 mm , width 2.35–3.10 mm . Body oval, with short yellowish pubescence. Integument of pronotum, scutellar shield and elytra orangeish, without spots, anterior border of pronotum translucent ( Figs. 2A, D ). Head, antennae and mouthparts yellowish ( Fig. 2C ). Meso- and metaventrite brownish. Epipleuron yellowish or brownish, with deep excavations to receive femora. Legs yellowish to brownish, tibiae and tarsi yellowish ( Fig. 2B ). Meso- and metaventrite brownish. Abdomen with middle region of ventrites brownish.
Etymology . This species is named in honor of the collector of the type series, Dr. Stéphane Brûlé.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Geographical Distribution.
French Guiana
(Roura, Saül, Régina, Saint-Elie, Camopi) ( Fig. 7 ).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material . FRENCH GUIANA: Commune de Roura : “Guyane française,/Montagne des Chevaux,/RN2 PK22, Commune/de Roura, 26.VI.2011 ,/vitre,/Stéphane Brûlé leg.”, “♂”, “MNHN”, “HOLOTYPE/
Chnoodes brulei
” [red label]. The following specimens are designated as PARATYPE /
Chnoodes brulei
